sen.j: 錦市場（にしき いちば）は、京都市街ほぼ中央に位置する錦小路通のうち「寺町通 - 高倉通」間の商店街で、魚・京野菜などの生鮮食品食材や、乾物・漬物・おばんざい（京都言葉で日常の惣菜）などの加工食品を商う老舗・専門店が集まる市場。
sen.e: Nishiki Market is a shopping street which is on the Nishiki-koji Street between 'Teramachi Street and Takakura Street,' and approximately located in the center of Kyoto City; there are a lot of long-established stores and specialty stores that sell fresh foods like fish and Kyoto vegetables, and processed food such as dried goods, pickles, and obanzai (precooked food in Kyoto dialect).

Nishiki Market is a shopping street which is on Nishiki-koji Street between 'Teramachi Street and Takakura Street,' and approximately located in the center of Kyoto City; there are a lot of long-established stores and specialty stores that sell fresh foods like fish and Kyoto vegetables, and processed foods such as dried goods, pickles, and obanzai (precooked food in Kyoto dialect).

Nishiki Market is a shopping street which is on Nishikikoji-dori Street between 'Teramachi-dori Street and Takakura-dori Street,' and approximately located in the center of Kyoto City; there are a lot of long-established stores and specialty stores that sell fresh foods like fish and Kyoto vegetables, and processed foods such as dried goods, tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables), and obanzai (precooked food in Kyoto dialect).
sen.cmt: Nishiki-koji Street→Nishikikoji-dori Street、Teramachi Street→Teramachi-dori Street、Takakura Street→Takakura-dori Streetとしました。"pickles" -> "tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都独特の食材は、ほぼここで揃う。
sen.e: You can get most of the foods unique to Kyoto.
Most foods unique to Kyoto can be obtained here.
Most foods unique to Kyoto can be obtained here.

sen.j: 400年の歴史を持ち、京都市民からは「にしき」という愛称で呼び親しまれ、「京の台所」として地元の市民はもとより、新京極通商店街や寺町京極商店街とともに、観光客や修学旅行生も訪れる観光名所として活気のある市場として賑わう。
sen.e: With a history of 400 years, it is popularly known as 'Nishiki' among the people in Kyoto, and as one of the sightseeing spots, the 'Kyoto's Kitchen' is thronged with tourists and students on a school excursion as well as local people, together with the Shinkyogoku Street shopping district and Teramachi-Kyogoku shopping district.

With a history of 400 years, it is popularly known as 'Nishiki' among the people in Kyoto, and as a sightseeing spot, 'Kyoto's Kitchen' is crowded with tourists and students on school excursions as well as local people, together with the Shinkyogoku Street shopping district and Teramachi-Kyogoku shopping district.

With a history of 400 years, it is popularly known as 'Nishiki' among the people in Kyoto, and as a sightseeing spot, 'Kyoto's Kitchen' is crowded with tourists and students on school excursions as well as local people, together with the Shinkyogoku-dori Street shopping district and Teramachi-Kyogoku shopping district.

sen.j: スーパーマーケットや百貨店と違い、ここでは新鮮な旬の食材の品質のよさや豊富な品揃えが支持されて市民生活と密着しているところが最大の特徴となっている。
sen.e: Unlike supermarkets and department stores, the distinctive characteristic of Nishiki Market is closely related to the everyday lives of local people, known for the good quality of fresh foods in season and a wide range of things to choose from.

Unlike supermarkets and department stores, the distinctive characteristics of Nishiki Market are closely related to the everyday lives of local people, and is known for the seasonal, quality fresh foods and wide range of items.

Unlike supermarkets and department stores, the distinctive characteristics of Nishiki Market are closely related to the everyday lives of local people, and is known for the seasonal, quality fresh foods and wide range of items.

sen.j: そのため価格を高めに設定する店もあるが、高品質や豊富さから「ほんまもん」（本物）を扱っていると信頼し、納得する市民は少なくない。
sen.e: There are some stores that sell things at high prices, but many local people are satisfied with their high quality and a variety of stuff, placing trust in their dealing with 'honmamon (real stuff).'

There are some stores that sell items at high prices, but many local people are satisfied with their high quality and variety, placing their trust in the fact that they are deailing with 'honmamon (genuine items).'

There are some stores that sell items at high prices, but many local people are satisfied with their high quality and variety, placing their trust in the fact that they are deailing with 'honmamon' (genuine items).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: 他地域で「錦市場」を銘打つ店が増え、品質を維持するためにも京都府内の商店街で初めて「錦市場」の商標登録を取得している。
sen.e: As the number of stores which call themselves 'Nishiki Market' in other regions increased, it registered a trademark of 'Nishiki Market' for the first time as a shopping district in Kyoto City in order to maintain quality.

As the number of stores which call themselves 'Nishiki Market' in other regions increased, the market registered the trademark of 'Nishiki Market' for the first time as a shopping district in Kyoto City in order to establish and maintain their brand quality.

As the number of stores which call themselves 'Nishiki Market' in other regions increased, the market registered the trademark of 'Nishiki Market' for the first time as a shopping district in Kyoto City in order to establish and maintain their brand quality.

sen.j: 一方、臨時に「にしき」と銘打った食品コーナーを設ける百貨店も登場している。
sen.e: On the other hand, there was a department store which created a food section named 'Nishiki' temporarily.
On the other hand, there was a department store which temporarily crated a food section alled 'Nishiki.'
On the other hand, there was a department store which temporarily crated a food section alled 'Nishiki.'

sen.j: 京都の目抜き通り四条通の一本北の錦小路通に位置し、赤緑黄の色鮮やかなアーケードにおおわれた石畳の道の距離は、東西390メートル。
sen.e: The Nishiki-koji Street, where the Nishiki Market is located, runs parallel to the main street of Kyoto (Shijo Street) one block north of Shijo Street, and the path paved with stones and covered with the vivid arcade of red, green, and yellow is 390 meters long from east to west.

Nishiki-koji Street, where Nishiki Market is located, runs parallel to the main street of Kyoto (Shijo Street) one block north of Shijo Street, and the path is paved with stones and is covered with a vivid arcade of red, green, and yellow, and is 390 meters long from east to west.

Nishikikoji-dori Street, where Nishiki Market is located, runs parallel to the main street of Kyoto (Shijo-dori Street) one block north of Shijo-dori Street, and the path is paved with stones and is covered with a vivid arcade of red, green, and yellow, and is 390 meters long from east to west.

sen.j: 商店街振興組合に所属する店は約130店舗、道幅は3.2 - 5メートル、道に迫り出して商品や商品棚を並べる店舗が少なくなく実際はもっと狭い。
sen.e: Approximate 130 stores are members of the Shopping District Promotion Association; the width of the path is 3.2 to 5 meters, but not a few stores have shelves to display their articles protrude out onto the street, so the actual width of the path is narrower.

Approximate 130 stores are members of the Shopping District Promotion Association; the width of the path is 3.2 to 5 meters, but many stores have shelves to display their articles which protrude out onto the street, so the actual width of the path is narrower.

Approximate 130 stores are members of the Shopping District Promotion Association; the width of the path is 3.2 to 5 meters, but many stores have shelves to display their articles which protrude out onto the street, so the actual width of the path is narrower.

sen.j: 東の端は、新京極と交差し、その先に錦天満宮がある。
sen.e: The east end of the Nishiki Market crosses Shinkyogoku, and the Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine is located beyond there.
The east end of the Nishiki Market crosses Shinkyogoku, and beyond this location is where the Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine is located.
The east end of the Nishiki Market crosses Shinkyogoku, and beyond this location is where the Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine is located.

sen.j: ここで業務用の食材を仕入れる割烹、料亭、旅館なども多く、一般向けには京都名物のハモなど鮮魚を扱う店が20店舗以上と一番多い。
sen.e: Many kappo (Japanese-style restaurant), ryotei (Japanese-style restaurant), and ryokan (Japanese-style hotel) get in foodstuffs from this market, and for the ordinary customers, there are more than twenty stores which deal with fresh fish such as sea eel, which is specialties of Kyoto.

Many kappo (Japanese-style restaurant), ryotei (Japanese-style restaurant), and ryokan (Japanese-style hotel) obtain their ingredients from this market, and for the ordinary customers, there are more than twenty stores which deal with fresh fish such as sea eel, which is a specialty of Kyoto.

Many kappo (Japanese-style restaurant), ryotei (Japanese-style restaurant), and ryokan (Japanese-style hotel) obtain their ingredients from this market, and for the ordinary customers, there are more than twenty stores which deal with fresh fish such as sea eel, which is a specialty of Kyoto.

sen.j: そのほか伝統野菜とも呼ばれる京野菜、京漬物・豆腐やゆば・麩・ウナギ・佃煮・蒲鉾・干物・乾物などから茶・菓子・パン・寿司まで京料理の食材はほとんどここで揃うといっても過言ではない。
sen.e: It is not too much to say that you can get almost all the foodstuffs to make Kyoto cuisine here: Kyoto vegetable called traditional vegetable, Kyoto pickles, tofu, yuba (soy-milk skin), fu (wheat-gluten bread), eel, tsukudani (preserved food boiled down in soy sauce), kamaboko (boiled fish paste), dried fish, dried goods, tea, confectionery, bread, sushi, and so on.

It is not overstating to say that it is possible to obtain almost any kind of food needed in order to make Kyoto cuisine here: Kyoto vegetables called traditional vegetables, Kyoto pickles, tofu, yuba (soy-milk skin), fu (wheat-gluten bread), eel, tsukudani (preserved food boiled down in soy sauce), kamaboko (boiled fish paste), dried fish, dried goods, tea, confectionery, bread, sushi, and so on.

It is not overstating to say that it is possible to obtain almost any kind of food needed in order to make Kyoto cuisine here: Kyoto vegetables called traditional vegetables, Kyoto pickles, tofu, yuba (soy-milk skin), fu (wheat-gluten bread), eel, tsukudani (preserved food boiled down in soy sauce), kamaboko (boiled fish paste), dried fish, dried goods, tea, confectionery, bread, sushi, and so on.

sen.j: 豆乳ソフトクリームや豆乳ドーナツ、あるいはマグロのヅケ串などあまり見かけないものも売られ、また試食品を出す店もあり食べ歩きする人も少なくない。
sen.e: Unusual foods such as soft ice cream made from soy milk, doughnuts made from soy milk, and skewered tuna dipped in soy sauce, and not a few people walk around trying to eat free samples of food served by the stores.

Unusual foods such as soft ice cream made from soy milk, doughnuts made from soy milk, and skewered tuna dipped in soy sauce, are also available, and there are many who walk around tyring to eat free samples of food served by stores.

Unusual foods such as soft ice cream made from soy milk, doughnuts made from soy milk, and skewered tuna dipped in soy sauce, are also available, and there are many who walk around tyring to eat free samples of food served by stores.

sen.j: さらに茶房を出店しておにぎりを供する米屋や定食を供する八百屋、カウンターで焼きたての牡蠣を供する魚屋など、市場内で飲食を楽しむこともできる。
sen.e: Furthermore, you can enjoy eating and drinking in the market, for example, a rice store which serves rice balls at its tea room, a vegetable store which serves set meals, a fish store which serves oysters hot from the grill at the counter.

Furthermore, you can enjoy eating and drinking in the market, for example, a rice store which serves rice balls in a tea room, a vegetable store which serves set meals, a fish store which serves oysters hot from the grill at a counter.

Furthermore, you can enjoy eating and drinking in the market, for example, a rice store which serves rice balls in a tea room, a vegetable store which serves set meals, a fish store which serves oysters hot from the grill at a counter.

sen.j: 年の暮れには正月用の食材を求める客であふれ、上野のアメ横同様の混雑となる。
sen.e: At the end of the year, the market is crowded with people buying foodstuffs for the New Year, just like Ameyoko (short for Ameya-yokocho, or Ameya Streets; famous for its extremely cheap seasonal goods and other wares)

At the end of the year, the market is crowded with people buying food for the New Year, just like Ameyoko (short for Ameya-yokocho, or Ameya Streets; famous for its extremely cheap seasonal goods and other wares)

At the end of the year, the market is crowded with people buying food for the New Year, just like Ameyoko (short for Ameya-yokocho, or Ameya Streets; famous for its extremely cheap seasonal goods and other wares) in Ueno.
sen.cmt: 「上野の」を訳出、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 店舗の営業時間は、店にもよるが、おおむね午前九時から午後五時までが目安となっている。
sen.e: Business hour is different among the stores, but mostly they open from nine a.m. to five p.m.
Business hours are different among stores, but are mostly open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Business hours are different among stores, but are mostly open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

sen.j: 水曜日と日曜日に休業する店が多い。
sen.e: Many stores are closed on Wednesday and Sunday.
Most stores are closed on Wednesday and Sunday.
Most stores are closed on Wednesday and Sunday.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 2006年11月3日、同市場商店街振興組合はイタリアトスカーナ州フィレンツェ市公設の中央市場（itMercato Centrale (Firenze)。通称 サン・ロレンツォ市場）と知名度向上、観光客誘致、および相互理解を目的に友好提携を結んだ。
sen.e: On November 3, 2006, the Shopping District Promotion Association established friendly relations with Mercato Centrale of Firenze City, Toscana Region, Italy (commonly known as San Lorenzo Market) in order to gain wide publicity, attract tourists, and deepen mutual understanding.

On November 3, 2006, the Shopping District Promotion Association established friendly relations with Mercato Centrale of Firenze City, Toscana Region, Italy (commonly known as San Lorenzo Market) in order to gain publicity, attract tourists, and deepen mutual understanding.

On November 3, 2006, the Shopping District Promotion Association established friendly relations with Mercato Centrale of Firenze City, Toscana Region, Italy (commonly known as San Lorenzo Market) in order to gain publicity, attract tourists, and deepen mutual understanding.

sen.j: 1965年以来フィレンツェ市は京都市の姉妹都市で、四十周年を記念して始めた「錦市場でフィレンツェ・トスカーナを捜そう」（2005年1月 -）などのイベントを通じ、錦市場がフィレンツェと食文化交流を続けてきた成果の一つである。
sen.e: Since 1965, Firenze has had a sister city relationship with Kyoto City, and the event called 'Let's look for Firenze, Toscana at the Nishiki Market' began in order to commemorate the fortieth anniversary of their friendship, which was one of the achievements that the Nishiki Market has produced through food cultural exchange with Firenze.

Since 1965, Firenze has had a sister city relationship with Kyoto City, and the event called 'Let's look for Firenze, Toscana at the Nishiki Market' began in order to commemorate the 40th anniversary of their friendship, and was one achievement that the Nishiki Market has produced through their food-based cultural exchange with Firenze.

Since 1965, Firenze has had a sister city relationship with Kyoto City, and the event called 'Let's look for Firenze, Toscana at the Nishiki Market' (January, 2005 -) began in order to commemorate the 40th anniversary of their friendship, and was one achievement that the Nishiki Market has produced through their food-based cultural exchange with Firenze.

sen.j: イタリア発祥の「スローフード運動」に学ぶことも目的の一つとなっている。
sen.e: To learn 'slow food movement' originated in Italy is also one of the purposes.
Another purpose was for the Market to learn the 'slow food movement' which originated in Italy.
Another purpose was for the Market to learn the 'slow food movement' which originated in Italy.

sen.j: 友好提携締結の翌2007年の4月24日から26日にかけて中央市場関係者を招いて同市場内でフィレンツェ市の食材を紹介するイベントを開き、近隣のイタリア料理店の協力をえて関連ブース四店を開設、無料のワイン試飲やトスカーナ伝統料理の試食を通しフィレンツェの食文化を紹介した。
sen.e: A promotion event of Firenze's foodstuffs was held from April 24 through 26 in 2007, the following year when the friendship ties was established, and with the support of neighboring Italian restaurants, four related booths were set up to introduce food culture of Firenze, serving free sample wine and Tuscan traditional food.

An event to promote Firenze's foodstuffs was held from April 24 through 26 in 2007, the following year when the friendship ties was established, and with the support of neighboring Italian restaurants, four related booths were set up to introduce the food culture of Firenze, serving free sample wine and Tuscan traditional food.

An event to promote Firenze's foodstuffs was held from April 24 through 26 in 2007, the following year when the friendship ties was established, and with the support of neighboring Italian restaurants, four related booths were set up to introduce the food culture of Firenze, serving free sample wine and Tuscan traditional food.

sen.j: 京都府とトスカーナ州の「経済・環境交流提携等に関する協定」（2006年11月締結）について山田啓二京都府知事と会談するため初来日したトスカーナ州のクラウディオ・マルティーニ (itClaudio Martini) 州知事も同イベント会場を友好訪問している。
sen.e: Claudio Martini, President of Tuscany, who made a first trip to Japan to have a meeting with Keiji YAMADA, Governor of Kyoto Prefecture, also paid a friendly visit to the promotion event; the purpose of the meeting was to discuss 'An agreement about economy and environmental exchange' (concluded in November, 2006) between Kyoto Prefecture and Toscany.

Claudio Martini, President of Tuscany, who made a first trip to Japan to have a meeting with Keiji YAMADA, Governor of Kyoto Prefecture, also paid a friendly visit to the promotion event; the purpose of the meeting was to discuss 'An agreement about economy and environmental exchange' (concluded in November, 2006) between Kyoto Prefecture and Toscany.

Claudio MARTINI, President of Tuscany, who made a first trip to Japan to have a meeting with Keiji YAMADA, Governor of Kyoto Prefecture, also paid a friendly visit to the promotion event; the purpose of the meeting was to discuss 'An agreement about economy and environmental exchange' (concluded in November, 2006) between Kyoto Prefecture and Toscany.

sen.j: フィレンツェ中央市場（イタリア）：2006年11月3日友好提携
sen.e: Mercato Centrale of Firenze (Italy): friendship ties established on November 3, 2006.
Mercato Centrale of Firenze (Italy): friendship ties established on November 3, 2006.
Mercato Centrale of Firenze (Italy): friendship ties established on November 3, 2006.
